articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Egyptian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Egyptian President 
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a message of greetings to Muhammad Hosni Mubarak, Egyptian president, on the occasion of the 58th anniversary of the July 23 revolution, a national holiday of the Egyptian people. 
					 Expressing belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the DPRK and Egypt would continue to grow stronger, the message sincerely wished the president bigger success in his work for the fair settlement of the Mideast issue and the country's prosperity.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Greets Egyptian PM
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Greets Egyptian PM
Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Choe Yong Rim, premier of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Ahmed Najef, Prime Minister of Egypt, on Thursday on the occasion of the 58th anniversary of the significant July 23 revolution of the Egyptian people.
					 The message wished him great success in his work for realizing social justice and improving the standard of people's living. 
					
					 On the same day Pak Ui Chun, foreign minister of the DPRK, sent a similar message to his Egyptian counterpart Ahmed Abu al-Gheit.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets World Conference of Speakers
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets World Conference of Speakers
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, separately met and had talks with the chairman of the Standing Committee of the Chinese National People's Congress and speakers of the parliament of Cuba, Syria, Mongolia, India and Iran. He participated in the third world conference of speakers of parliament held in Geneva.
					Wu Bangguo, chairman of the Standing Committee of the Chinese National People's Congress, said that General Secretary Kim Jong Il's visit to China in May contributed to boosting Sino-Korean friendship, pointing out that the two countries grandly celebrated the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the two countries and held events marking the "year of China-DPRK friendship" in 2009, demonstrating the bilateral friendship.
					
					 He hoped that the party and government of the DPRK would achieve bigger successes under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Ricardo Alarcon, president of the National Assembly of People's Power of Cuba, said that the relations between Cuba and the DPRK provided by Fidel Castro Ruz and President Kim Il Sung are growing stronger under the deep care of Raul Castro Ruz and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Cuban party and government will express invariable support and solidarity with the party and government of the DPRK, he declared.
					
					 Mahmoud Al-Abrashi, president of the People's Assembly of Syria, said that they are thankful to the Korean people for extending support and solidarity to the Syrian people's cause of justice, hoping that the two parliaments would closely cooperate with each other in the common struggle against the U.S. in the future, too, in keeping with the friendly relations between the two countries developing on good terms.
					
					 Demberel Damdin, chairman of the State Great Hural of Mongolia, expressed the willingness to enhance the parliamentary role in boosting the bilateral relations.
					
					 Meira Kumar, speaker of the Lok Sabha of India, said that India and the DPRK have contributed to the strengthening of the Non-Aligned Movement, declaring the willingness to exert efforts to develop the relations between the two parliaments.
					
					 Ali Larijani, speaker of the Iranian Majlis, said that the Iranian people remember the big assistance given by Kim Il Sung to Iran when it was suffering from difficulties, stressing that Iran and the DPRK are independent countries standing firm against the pressure and sanctions by the U.S. and other Western countries.
					
					 Choe Thae Bok also met with the deputy speaker of the Italian Chamber of Deputies.

articles.title: Military Attaches Corps Visits Panmunjom
articles.content:
Military Attaches Corps Visits Panmunjom
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- The military attaches corps here visited Panmunjom Thursday on the occasion of the 57th anniversary of the great victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Members of the corps went round the monument to President Kim Il Sung's signature associated with his undying exploits performed in the noble cause for achieving the reunification of the country.
					
					 Being briefed on the shining victory won by the army and people of the DPRK in the Fatherland Liberation War under the wise leadership of the President, they went round the meeting room of the armistice talks, the hall where the Armistice Agreement was signed and the meeting room of the former Military Armistice Commission.
					
					 The guests made entries in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Friendly Meeting with Egyptians Held
articles.content:
Friendly Meeting with Egyptians Held
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- A friendly gathering with staff members of the Egyptian embassy here took place at the DPRK-Egypt Friendship Pyongyang Textile Mill on Thursday on the occasion of the 58th anniversary of the July 23 revolution in Egypt.
					 Present there on invitation were Ambassador Ismail Abdelrahman Ghoneim Hussein and staff members of the embassy.
					
					 On hand were So Ho Won, vice-chairman of the DPRK-Egypt Friendship Association, and officials concerned and officials of the mill.
					
					 The participants made the rounds of several workshops of the mill.
					
					 They talked to one another about the need to boost the relations between the two countries, deepening the friendship.

articles.title: DPRK Again Hit by Torrential Rain
articles.content:
DPRK Again Hit by Torrential Rain
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Some parts of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea were hit again by torrential rain under the influence of subtropical anticyclone from the Northwestern  Pacific and low atmospheric pressure that moved to the northern area from north  of the West Sea of Korea. 
					 According to information available from 0: 0 of July 21 to 21 of July 22, rainfall registered over 200mm in Unsan County of North Phyongan Province and Songwon County of Jagang Province and more than 180 mm in Singye County of North Hwanghae Province, Ryongrim County of Jagang Province, Phangyo County of Kangwon Province and Yodok area of South Hamgyong Province. 
					
					 Torrential rain hit nearly 50 local areas including Huichon City of Jagang Province, Pukchang and Maengsan counties of South Phyongan Province, Thaechon County of North Phyongan Province, Poptong County of Kangwon Province, Yongkwang and Hamju counties of South Hamgyong Province.

articles.title: Day of Victory in War Celebrated
articles.content:
Day of Victory in War Celebrated 
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- An oratorical meeting of youth and students took place in front of main sculpture "Victory" at the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Memorial Tower and a national oratorical meeting of officials and members of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea at the Central Hall of Workers on Thursday in celebration of the 57th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The performers at the meetings highly lauded the immortal exploits President Kim Il Sung performed by defeating the U.S. imperialists who boasted of being "the strongest" in the world with his unique war methods and leading the Fatherland Liberation War to victory and the leadership art and personality of Kim Jong Il who has defended and glorified the socialist country with his Songun politics.
					
					 They referred to the indomitable spirit displayed by the army and people of the DPRK in firmly defending every inch of the country through popular heroism, united close around Kim Il Sung during the war.
					
					 They praised Kim Jong Il as the eternal banner of victory in the Korean revolution as he has brought a rosy future of a thriving nation to this land in which the President's desire is in full bloom, while foiling the imperialists' moves to stifle the DPRK with arms of Songun.
					
					 On the same day a concert of agricultural workers "We Will Always Glorify the Great Exploits Performed for Winning the Victory in the War" took place in Jangsan-ri, Ryongchon County of North Phyongan Province, on the above-said occasion.
					
					 Put on the stage were chorus " July 27, Our Victory Day", male solo and pangchang "For My Only Motherland", mixed chorus "We Have Won", mixed quartet "Let Us Meet at the Front" and other numbers.

articles.title: State Academic Degrees and Titles Awarded to Intellectuals
articles.content:
State Academic Degrees and Titles Awarded to Intellectuals
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- State academic degrees and titles were awarded to the intellectuals in recognition of their scientific and technological achievements.
					 An awarding ceremony was held on July 21.
					
					 The title of academician went to Pak Je Un, room chief of Wonsan University of Agriculture, and the titles of candidate academician to O Hui Bok, teacher at Kim Il Sung University, Rim Thae Gun, head of a department of the university, and Ri Pong Sik, teacher at Kim Chaek University of Technology. 
					
					 Professorship was conferred upon Kim Pyong Suk, guidance lecturer at the Grand People's Study House, Kim Jong Ung, head of a department of a branch school of University of Science.
					
					 Doctorate went to Choe Su Nam and Ri Chol Su, heads of departments of Kim Il Sung University, Kim Jong Gil, dean of a faculty of Pyongyang Medical College of Kim Il Sung University, Pak Nam Su, researcher at Kim Chaek University of Technology, and others. And assistant professorship was awarded to 50 persons.

articles.title: Korean Artistes Wrap up 70 Odd Day Performance Tour
articles.content:
Korean Artistes Wrap up 70 Odd Day Performance Tour
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Opera "A Dream of Red Mansions" had been staged by artistes of the Phibada Opera Troupe of the DPRK before full house in China for over 70 days from May 7 to July 18.
					 The Korean artistes staged the opera more than 30 times in 12 cities including Beijing, Tianjin, Shenyang and Dalian visited by General Secretary Kim Jong Il. Their performance in the wake of his successful unofficial visit to China added to the atmosphere of the DPRK-China friendship.
					
					 They gave more than 10 additional performances in Tianjin, Changchun, Shenyang, Dalian and other areas, repeatedly extending their stay at the request of the Chinese people.
					
					 The venues of performances were always packed to capacity with those not only from different parts of China including Taipei but from Japan, the United States, Canada and other regions of the world. A great many people made trips to watch the opera, following the Korean artistes' course.
					
					 As the opera gained in popularity with each passing day, the number of the audience far exceeded the expected number in different parts of China and Chinese and world media vied with each other to cover the performances.
					
					 On the initiative of Kim Jong Il, this opera was produced in keeping with the principle of historicism and the modern aesthetic taste in the DPRK on the occasion of the "year of the DPRK-China friendship" in 2009 marking the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the two countries.
					
					 All elements of representation including the arrangement of orchestra, dance, pangchang (offstage singing) and stage decor are based on theoretical and practical achievements gained in the production of the five revolutionary operas in the DPRK.
					
					 The performance of opera "A Dream of Red Mansions", which won highest acclaim from across China, gave great joy and encouragement to the peoples of the two countries wishing for steady and vigorous development of the bilateral relations in the new century and made significant contributions to deepening their friendship.

articles.title: Fish Breeding in Rice Fields Encouraged
articles.content:
Fish Breeding in Rice Fields Encouraged
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Fish breeding in rice fields of cooperative farms has been encouraged in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 Many co-op farms, including those in Sadong and Samsok Districts of Pyongyang and Taedong County of South Phyongan Province, have benefited from fish breeding in paddy fields -- increasing the yield of rice and supplying fishes to peasants without consumption of labor, fertilizers and agrochemicals.
					
					 Cooperative farms in Samsok District have put hundreds of thousands of fries in many rice fields this year, too, making good conditions for fish breeding. 
					
					 Those in Taedong County have made levees of fish breeding paddy fields higher than others, providing peasants with scientific and technical information of fish breeding in rice fields.
					
					 The Kupho Cooperative Farm in Hwangju County, North Hwanghae Province has chosen rice fields favorable for irrigation and drainage and safe from flood and installed nets in their irrigation gates to prevent fries from slipping away.

articles.title: Summer Crops Harvest in High Gear
articles.content:
Summer Crops Harvest in High Gear
Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Harvest of various crops is at its height in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea in this hot season.
					The harvest of wheat and barley cultivated as earlier crops has already been finished in flat areas on the west coast in a short span of time.
					
					North and South Hwanghae Provinces have finished the harvest in right time by rationalizing manpower allotment with various farm works done at the same time. Such achievements have been made in North and South Phyongan Provinces, too.
					
					Many co-op farms which had already finished the harvest of wheat and barley have begun drying and storing grains in a scientific and technological way, harvesting potatoes, planting aftercrops and manuring their fields. 
					
					The Kosan Fruit Farm in a mountain area of the eastern part of the country is now busy with the harvest of early-ripening fruits. It has produced a high yield of fruits by applying quality manure and cultivating fruit trees as required by the Juche farming methods.
					
					The harvest of tea leaves has also begun in Kangryong on the west coast.

articles.title: End to Dictatorial Rule in S. Korea Urged
articles.content:
End to Dictatorial Rule in S. Korea Urged
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- It is inevitable for the south Korean people to launch massive resistance to put an end to the dictatorial rule of the conservative group in order to realize their desire for independence, democracy and reunification.
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday observes this in a signed article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The south Korean ruling forces are kicking up with bloodshot eyes a terror-ridden atmosphere of suppression of the progressive democratic forces as a revenge for the heavy defeat inflicted upon them in the "elections to local self-governing bodies".
					
					 This brutal repressive campaign of those forces has thrown different civic and public organizations including the "Korean National Council for the Promotion of the Reunification by Federal Formula" and the Headquarters of the Movement for the Withdrawal of the U.S. Forces and even innocent citizens into the mire of pain and uneasiness.
					
					 The dictatorship and suppression so frantically intensified by the south Korean ruling forces in utter disregard of the people's mind-set are aimed at recovering their crushing defeat in the above-said elections through their fascist crackdown, tiding over their ruling crisis and quelling the resolution of the progressive democratic forces to come out against them in the forthcoming "by-election to the National Assembly."
					
					 The reality goes to prove that the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors is resorting to its high-handed and arbitrary actions, dictatorship and suppression in order to prolong its political careers and it is, therefore, impossible to achieve independent and democratic development of the south Korean society and achieve national reunification unless its treacherous rule is terminated. There should be neither expectation nor illusion about the Lee dictatorial forces, concludes the daily.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Liquidate Its Crime-woven Past
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Liquidate Its Crime-woven Past
Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- The chief of "For the restoration of justice," a Korean social organization in Sakhalin, when addressing a recent seminar held in Yuzhno-Sakhalinsk of Russia, disclosed the atrocities committed by the Japanese imperialists against Koreans in Sakhalin during the Second World War. He strongly demanded the Japanese authorities pay full reparation for the damage done to them.
					According to data available, there were about 40,000 Koreans in Sakhalin as of August 1945 when the Japanese imperialists suffered a defeat. Most of the wages unpaid to those Koreans who were forced to slave by the Japanese imperialists in Sakhalin at that time are still registered in the account books of Japanese banks but Japan has refused to pay them, feigning ignorance of them.
					
					 Minju Joson Thursday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 The issue of paying reparation for the damage done to the Koreans in Sakhalin is a historical task to be fulfilled by the Japanese government in a responsible manner as it cropped up due to the Japanese imperialists in the past from every point of view.
					
					 It is due obligation and duty of the assailant to make an apology and reparation to the victim in this world as the former brought misfortune and pain to the latter.
					
					 It is only Japan that has persistently shunned reparation for the damage, denying the blood-stained history woven with crimes even today when more than half a century has passed since the end of the war.
					
					 If Japan were to pay the Koreans for the mental and material damage done to them, Japan's offer of its whole territory would not be enough to do so.
					
					 Japan's settlement of its past is not a matter which allows it to evade it but a legal and moral obligation and duty to be fulfilled by it under any circumstances. 
					
					 Japan's persistent efforts to dodge the settlement of its past would only add to its crimes and render it more bitterly refuted and condemned by the international community.

articles.title: Full Display of Might of Single-minded Unity Called for
articles.content:
Full Display of Might of Single-minded Unity Called for
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Thursday in an editorial calls upon all the people to intensify the high-pitched drive for greeting the conference of the Workers' Party of Korea with high political enthusiasm and signal labor achievements and thus fully demonstrate Songun Korea's stamina of single-minded unity.
					 It is the revolutionary traits of the Korean people to give full play to the mental power of single-minded unity in every period of weighty significance in the development of the WPK and the revolution, the editorial says, and goes on:
					
					 In 1966 the Korean people conducted the vigorous drive to carry out the Seven-Year Plan in the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance with the WPK conference held in October as an occasion, and at the time of the 6th Congress of the WPK they staged an all-out drive for sweeping socialist construction to build a great number of monumental edifices representing the era of the Workers' Party in different parts of the country.
					
					 The great mental power of single-minded unity served as a driving force that helped Korean-style socialism shine as an invincible bulwark even in the worst adversity of the "Arduous March", the forced march in the 1990s and made it possible to declare the building of a thriving nation in this land.
					
					 Today our army and people, rallied as one in mind and purpose, are conducting the general offensive to greet the WPK conference with laudable achievements of the great revolutionary surge. The completion of Taegyedo Tideland reclamation is an admirable labor gift presented by the Korean working class to the 65th anniversary of the WPK and its conference, and it is a historic miracle brought by the inexhaustible might of single-minded unity of the army and people closely rallied around the WPK.
					
					 The single-minded unity of the party, the army and the people--this represents the strength, victory and rosy future of the DPRK. The WPK conference is at hand, and it is high time that we demonstrated once again the might of single-minded unity that was cemented in the protracted historic struggle and grew stronger on the road of the Songun revolution. 
					
					 There will be no fortress impossible for us to attain when we have the do-or-die spirit and the matchless working spirit to materialize the plan and intention of the WPK without fail.

articles.title: "Results of Investigation" of Joint Investigation Team Refuted
articles.content:
"Results of Investigation" of Joint Investigation Team Refuted
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Ri Jong In, representative of a south Korean diving technology corporation, when interviewed by a reporter of the internet newspaper Thongil News on July 15, refuted the "results of investigation" into the warship case published by the puppet joint investigation team.
					 He referred to the fact that when examining the metal pieces which had been left in the waters off Inchon for 50 days since right after the publication of the above-said results, he found them rusty a little. 
					
					 Noting that he could obtain these results of the experiment though it was provided with ample conditions for the metal pieces to get rusty as heavily as possible, he held that it would take ten years at maximum for the metal pieces to get rusty so seriously under sea water as shown by the torpedo wreckage produced by the above-said team.
					
					 He insisted that the warship "Cheonan" was not sunk by explosion under any circumstances.
					
					 Pointing out that the warship ran on a rock before sinking, he explained that when water rushed into the broken part of the ship, it began sinking while the other part of the ship resisted it with buoyant force, causing it to break into two pieces in the end. 
					
					 He went on to say: A photograph of the retrieved stern clearly showed the trace of the stranding. I was confident when examining myself the damage to the hull that it was hit first and then filled with water, causing a big difference in the weight of its bow and stern which resulted in cutting it into two pieces.

articles.title: Korean People's Just Struggle Supported
articles.content:
Korean People's Just Struggle Supported
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of Switzerland issued a joint statement on July 12 as regards the adoption of the presidential statement at the United Nations Security Council.
					 The joint statement noted that the south Korean authorities brought up the case of warship "Cheonan" for discussion at the UNSC in an attempt to seek another "sanctions" against the DPRK, but the UNSC concluded its discussion on this issue without adopting any resolution.
					
					 It is the victory of the DPRK's diplomacy that the UNSC took heed to the stand of the DPRK, the statement said, adding that this is the victory of justice.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists and the Lee Myung Bak clique's scheme to impose sanctions on the DPRK came to failure while being rejected, it said, stressing:
					
					 We congratulate the DPRK on its recent great victory and support the just demand for replacing the Armistice Agreement with a peace treaty.

articles.title: Solidarity with Korean People Expressed
articles.content:
Solidarity with Korean People Expressed
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- Meetings were held in Pakistan and Guinea and film shows and photo exhibitions in South Africa and Malaysia between July 12 and 15 on the occasion of the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 Speeches were made at the events.
					
					The secretary general of the Lahore Branch of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association praised the immortal feats performed by President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il in the realization of the country's reunification.
					
					 The DPRK has the strong People's Army, the might of the unbreakable single-minded unity of the leader, the party and the mass and the military capability strong enough to face down the U.S., he stressed.
					
					 The general secretary of the Pakistan Organization for Afro-Asian People's Solidarity charged that the U.S. is bringing the dark clouds of a nuclear war to hang over the Korean Peninsula again and has persistently hindered the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea while inflicting the misfortune and pain of national division upon the Korean people for over 60 years.  
					
					 He said: We are struck with admiration at the Korean people stubbornly fighting on the forefront against the U.S. arbitrary practices and aggression moves under the great Songun politics of Kim Jong Il and given great encouragement from this fact.
					
					 Appreciated at the film shows were "Ever-victorious and Invincible Ranks of Parade", "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation" and other Korean films.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised in Ecuador
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised in Ecuador
 Pyongyang, July 22 (KCNA) -- The Ecuadorian national preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung issued a bulletin on July 16 on the occasion of the 16th anniversary of his demise.
					 The bulletin in an article titled "Kim Il Sung, the eternal sun of the DPRK" said that the President embarked on the road of the revolution in his teens and founded the immortal Juche idea, the guideline for the human cause of independence.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The DPRK, founded by the President, was turned into a socialist state that embodied the principles of independence in politics, self-support in the economy and self-reliance in national defence. 
					
					 He is the gifted strategist who defeated the two U.S. and Japanese imperialisms.
					
					It is his lifelong desire and the steadfast will of General Secretary Kim Jong Il to achieve the country's reunification independently and peacefully.
					
					 We actively support the DPRK's efforts for national reunification and call upon the progressive mankind to extend full solidarity to the Korean people's cause of justice.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok se reune con sus homologos de varios paises
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok se reune con sus homologos de varios paises
Pyongyang, 22 de julio (ATCC) -- El presidente de la Asamblea Popular Suprema (APS) de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Choe Thae Bok, quien participa en la III Conferencia Mundial de los Presidentes de Parlamentos efectuada en Ginebra, se reunio por separado con el presidente del Comite Permanente de la Asamblea Popular Nacional de China y otros presidentes de los parlamentos de Cuba, Siria, Mongolia, la India e Iran.
					En la ocasion, el presidente del Comite Permanente de la Asamblea Popular Nacional de China, Wu Bangguo, dijo que la visita a China del Dirigente Kim Jong Il en mayo contribuyo a desarrollar las relaciones de amistad China-Corea y se refirio a que se celebro solemnemente en 2009 el 60o aniversario del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas bilaterales y se ostentaron las relaciones de amistad entre ambos paises a traves de las actividades dedicadas al "Ano de Amistad China-Corea".
					
					El deseo que bajo la guia del Dirigente el partido y el gobierno de Corea logren mayores exitos. 
					
					El presidente de la Asamblea Nacional del Poder Popular de Cuba, Ricardo Alarcon, senalo que las relaciones entre Cuba y Corea, preparadas por el companero Fidel Castro Ruz y el Presidente        Kim Il Sung, se consolidan y se desarrollan en medio de profunda atencion del camarada Raul Castro Ruz y el camarada Kim Jong Il.
					
					Anadio que el partido y el gobierno de Cuba expresaran invariable apoyo y solidaridad al partido y el gobierno de Corea.
					
					El presidente de la Asamblea Popular de la Republica Arabe de Siria, Mahmoud Al-Abrashi, agradecio al pueblo coreano que envia el apoyo y la solidaridad a la justa causa del pueblo sirio y manifesto el deseo de fortalecer la cooperacion entre los dos parlamentos en la lucha comun antiyanqui conforme a las relaciones de amistad entre los dos paises, que se desarrollan favorablemente. 
					
					El presidente del Gran Hural del Estado de Mongolia, D. Demberel, manifesto su voluntad de fortalecer el papel de los parlamentos para desarrollar las relaciones entre ambos paises.
					
					El presidente de la Camara Popular de la Republica de la India, Meira Kumar, senalo que la India y Corea contribuyen al fortalecimiento del Movimiento de los No Alineados y destaco que se esforzara por el desarrollo de las relaciones entre los parlamentos de ambos paises.
					
					El presidente de la Asamblea Consultiva Islamica de la Republica Islamica de Iran, Ali Larijani, subrayo que el pueblo irani recuerda el hecho de que el Presidente Kim Il Sung le habia ofrecido mucha asistencia cuando Iran sufria dificultades y apunto que Iran y Corea son los paises independientes que luchan contra la opresion y la sancion de EE.UU. y el Occidente.
					
					Choe se reunio tambien con el vicepresidente de la Camara de Diputados de la Republica de Italia.

articles.title: Cuerpo de Agregados Militares recorre Phanmunjom
articles.content:
Cuerpo de Agregados Militares recorre Phanmunjom
Pyongyang, 22 de julio (ATCC) -- Con motivo del 57o aniversario de la gran victoria del pueblo coreano en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria, el Cuerpo de Agregados Militares acreditado en Corea visito el dia 22 Phanmunjom.
					Los visitantes recorrieron la lapida con la firma del Presidente, que transmite su inmortal hazana dejada en la realizacion de la sagrada causa para lograr la reunificacion de la patria.
					
					Escuchando explicaciones de que gracias a la sabia direccion del Presidente el ejercito y el pueblo coreanos lograron la resonante victoria en la pasada Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria, los huespedes recorrieron la sala de negociaciones de armisticio, la sala de firma del Acuerdo de Armisticio y la sala de reuniones de la Comision Militar del Armisticio.
					
					Notaron sus impresiones en el libro de visitas.

articles.title: Japon debe hacer liquidacion de su pasado criminal, exige Minju Joson
articles.content:
Japon debe hacer liquidacion de su pasado criminal, exige Minju Joson
Pyongyang, 22 de julio (ATCC) -- En el seminario recien celebrado en Yuzhno-Sajalinsk, Rusia, el jefe de la entidad social de coreanos en Sajalin "Por el rescate de la justicia",  revelo las atrocidades de los imperialistas japoneses cometidas en Sajalin durante la Segunda Guerra Mundial y demando fuertemente a las autoridades japonesas indemnizarlo sin falta.
					Segun los datos, en agosto de 1945 cuando los imperialistas japoneses sufrieron la derrota, vivian en Sajalin 40 mil coreanos, aproximadamente.
					
					Estan registrados en el libro de ahorros de los bancos japoneses la mayoria de los salarios no pagados a los coreanos quienes en aquel entonces hacian trabajos forzosos en Sajalin por los imperialistas japoneses. Sin embargo, Japon niega todavia a pagarlos. 
					
					La indemnizacion a los coreanos en Sajalin es un problema surgido en el pasado por ellos y una tarea historica asumida al actual gobierno japones. 
					
					Senala el rotativo Minju Joson en un comentario individual de este jueves y prosigue:
					
					 Uno que causo desgracias y sufrimientos a otro debe pedirle disculpa y hacerle indemnizacion merecida. 
					
					Esto se considera como una obligacion moral en este mundo humano. 
					
					  Sin embargo, durante mas de medio siglo posbelico, solo Japon niega su historia criminal ensangrentada y evade persistentemente la indemnizacion por el respecto. 
					
					  Aunque entregara todo el territorio japones, Japon no podra indemnizar al pueblo coreano por sus perdidas espirituales y materiales.
					
					  La liquidacion del pasado criminal no es un simple problema, sino es una obligacion y responsabilidad legales y morales de Japon. 
					
					  Si este pais isleno sigue evadiendo la liquidacion de su pasado criminal, se aumentaran sus crimenes y se agrandaran tanto mas las protestas y repudios de la sociedad internacional.

articles.title: Hay que acabar con el dominio dictatorial, aboga Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Hay que acabar con el dominio dictatorial, aboga Rodong Sinmun
						
Pyongyang, 22 de julio (ATCC) -- Para realizar el anhelo de los habitantes surcoreanos a la independencia, la democracia y la reunificacion, es inevitable la sublevacion masiva por acabar con la dominacion dictatorial de la banda de los conservadores surcoreanos.
					Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual difundido este jueves y continua:
					
					En estos dias, las fuerzas gobernantes del Sur de Corea arman una horrorosa represion contra las fuerzas democratas progresistas que les dieron la derrota en las "elecciones de autonomia local".
					
					Debido a tal barbara represion, varias entidades civiles y sociales incluyendo el Consejo de Promocion por la Reunificacion Federal de Nuestra Nacion y la Direccion del Movimiento por la Retirada de Tropas Norteamericanas, y hasta los inocentes civiles sufren dolores e inquietudes.
					
					Hoy dia, las fuerzas surcoreanas en el poder recurren a la dictadura y la represion despreciando la opinion publica a fin de evadir con la represion fascista la gran derrota en las "elecciones de autonomia local", salvarse de la crisis de su gobernacion y doblegar el impetu de las fuerzas democratas progresistas que se les sublevan en visperas de las "elecciones adicionales de parlamentarios".
					
					La realidad muestra que mientras existe la dominacion de la banda del traidor Lee Myung Bak que apela al despotismo, las arbitrariedades, la dictadura y la represion para mantener su vida restante politica, no pueden lograr el desarrollo independiente y democratico de la sociedad surcoreana ni tampoco la reunificacion del pais.
					
					Nadie debe tener cualquier esperanza o ilusion sobre las fuerzas dictatoriales de Lee Myung Bak.

articles.title: Entidades suizas se refieren a la declaracion de presidente del CS
articles.content:
Entidades suizas se refieren a la declaracion de presidente del CS
Pyongyang, 22 de julio (ATCC) -- Con motivo de la aprobacion de la declaracion del presidente del Consejo de Seguridad (CS) de la ONU, el Comite Suiza-Corea y el Grupo Suizo de Estudio de la Idea Juche hicieron publica el dia 12 una declaracion conjunta.
					El documento senala que las autoridades surcoreanas llevaron al CS de la ONU el incidente de hundimiento de la corbeta "Cheonan" persiguiendo nueva "sancion" contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea (RPDC), pero, esta entidad internacional termino la discusion sobre el particular sin aprobar ninguna resolucion.
					
					El CS de la ONU ha tomado en cuenta la posicion de la RPDC, lo cual deviene la victoria diplomatica de esta y el triunfo de la justicia, apunta. 
					
					Enfatiza que las maniobras de los imperialistas norteamericanos y la banda de Lee Myung Bak, que pretendian aplicar la sancion sobre la RPDC, quedaron fracasadas y ellos se vieron repudiados.
					
					La nota felicita la victoria de la RPDC en el trato del caso del "Cheonan" y expresa el apoyo a la demanda justa de este pais asiatico de sustituir el Acuerdo de Armisticio de Corea por el convenio de paz.
